# identifier

**Instance Property**

The unique identifier of the interaction.

## Declaration

```swift
var identifier: String { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property is initialized to a new UUID at initialization time, but you can change it if you want to use a different identification scheme. The identifier you assign to this property must be unique within your app.

## Accessing Interaction Attributes

- **intentHandlingStatus**: The current state of the interaction.
- **direction**: The direction in which information flowed to or from the device.
- **dateInterval**: The time at which the interaction started and its duration.
- **groupIdentifier**: The unique identifier of the interaction’s group.
